tables.Question: Ask: What is the (year)(season)(date)(day)(month)?
tables.Points Awarded: One point for each correct answer

tables.Question: Ask: Where are we (city)(state)(country)(hospital)(floor)?
tables.Points Awarded: One point for each correct answer

tables.Question: Name three objects.Â  Ask patient to immediately repeat named objects
tables.Points Awarded: One point for each correct object repeated

tables.Question: Serial 7's-Ask patient to start at 100 and count backwards by 7ORSpell WORLD backwards
tables.Points Awarded: One point for each correct number (93, 86, 79, 72, 65) or letter

tables.Question: Ask patient to recall and state the three objects previously named
tables.Points Awarded: One point for each object recalled

tables.Question: Point to a pencil and watch and ask the patient to name the objects
tables.Points Awarded: One point for each correctly named object

tables.Question: Ask the patient to repeat, "no ifs, ands or buts"
Ask patient to take a sheet of paper in his/her right hand, fold it in half, and place it on the floor.
tables.Points Awarded: One point for each task performed correctly

tables.Question: Ask patient to read and obey the following "Close your eyes." (this task is written on a sheet of paper)
Ask patient to write a sentence
tables.Points Awarded: One point for writing a sentence with noun/verb and is sensible

tables.Question: Copy this design (interlocking pentagons)
tables.Points Awarded: One point for the patients design containing all angles and intersecting

Analysis.text:
Mini-mental status exam
Score less than 24 suggests cognitive impairment
May be influenced by education and age
Score less than 29 if greater than 9 years of schooling suggests cognitive impairment
Score less than 26 if 5-9 years of schooling suggests cognitive impairment
Score less than 22 if less than 4 years of schooling suggests cognitive impairment
